FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our website screenshot service.

fullScreenshot.question: How to take a full screenshot of a website?
fullScreenshot.answer: To capture a full-page screenshot, simply enter the website URL and select 'Full Page' from the resolution options. Our tool will automatically scroll and capture the entire page length, including content that's not immediately visible in the viewport. This feature works best with our PDF format for optimal quality.

howToUse.question: How do I take a screenshot?
howToUse.answer: Simply enter the website URL in the input field, choose your preferred resolution and format, then click 'Take Screenshot'. The process is instant and requires no registration.

formats.question: What formats are supported?
formats.answer: We support PNG, JPEG, and PDF formats. PNG is best for high quality and transparency, JPEG for smaller file sizes, and PDF for document-style captures.

storage.question: Do you store my screenshots?
storage.answer: No, we don't provide permanent storage. Screenshots are generated temporarily and must be downloaded immediately. We prioritize your privacy by not storing any data.

privacy.question: Is my data safe?
privacy.answer: Absolutely. We don't store website content, screenshots, or any personal data. All processing is temporary and data is completely removed after each request.

limitations.question: Are there any limitations?
limitations.answer: We can screenshot any publicly accessible website. Pages requiring login, captchas, or special authentication cannot be captured. The service works best with standard web content.

popups.question: How do you handle cookie popups and ads?
popups.answer: Our service automatically detects and accepts cookie consent popups in multiple languages. You can also enable ad blocking to get cleaner screenshots without advertisements.

slow.question: Why do some screenshots take longer?
slow.answer: Screenshot time depends on the website's loading speed, content complexity, and server location. Sites with many images, scripts, or slow servers may take longer to process.

accuracy.question: Why doesn't my screenshot look exactly like my browser?
accuracy.answer: Different browsers may render pages slightly differently. We use a standardized rendering engine. If you notice significant differences, try adding a delay or contact us for support.
